title: 104_s819
content: The "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" may be cited as the short title. This Act includes provisions related to federal retirement for members of Congress and congressional employees. The "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" includes amendments to accrual and contribution rates for members of Congress and congressional employees under the Federal Employees Retirement System. The "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" includes amendments for applicable employees and Members of Congress, with regulations to be prescribed by the Secretary of the Senate and the Clerk of the House of Representatives. The provisions of this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. The amendments made by the "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" shall take effect on the date of enactment and apply to annuity computation for Members of Congress and Congressional employees from January 1, 1997 onwards. The amendments made by the "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" apply to the service of Members of Congress and Congressional employees, including military service before January 1, 1997. Contribution rates will take effect on the first applicable pay period after January 1, 1997. SEC. 3. INCREASE IN YEARS USED TO DETERMINE AVERAGE PAY. The amendments made by the "Federal Retirement Reform Act of 1995" apply to the service of Members of Congress and Congressional employees, including military service before January 1, 1997. The definition of average pay under the Civil Service Retirement System is amended to include the largest annual rate resulting from averaging an employee's rates of basic pay over any 3 consecutive years of creditable service. The definition of average pay under the Civil Service Retirement System is amended to include the largest annual rate resulting from averaging an employee's rates of basic pay over any 5 consecutive years of creditable service. The Civil Service Retirement System now includes the largest annual rate resulting from averaging an employee's rates of basic pay over any 3 consecutive years of service before 1995 and any 5 consecutive years of service after 1995. The annuity calculation for Civil Service Retirement System involves averaging an employee's rates of basic pay over any 5 consecutive years of service, weighted by the period it was in effect. In the Federal Employee Retirement System, the annuity calculation includes adding the product of average pay determined under two different sections of title 5. The Office of Personnel Management will create regulations for implementing the annuity calculation changes outlined in this section, effective January 1, 1996. SEC. 4. REDUCTION IN ACCRUAL RATES. The Civil Service Retirement System is amended to compute annuities based on service performed before and after January 1, 1996. The annuity formula includes percentages of average pay multiplied by total years of service. The Civil Service Retirement System calculates annuities based on service before and after January 1, 1996. The formula includes percentages of average pay multiplied by total years of service, with adjustments for larger annuities. The Federal Employees Retirement System, as amended, now includes adjustments to annuities based on service before and after January 1, 1996. The formula involves percentages of average pay multiplied by years of service, with specific changes for different time periods. The Federal Employees Retirement System, as amended, now includes adjustments to annuities based on service before and after January 1, 1996, with specific changes for different time periods. In subsection (g)(1), a new provision allows for adjustments of .9 percent, as applicable.
